extraction_metadata.source_document: The How Not to Diet Cookbook -- Michael Greger, MD

foods.name: Beans (Legumes)
properties: Excellent source of vitamins, minerals, fiber and antioxidants
Highest nutrition density - biggest bang for the buck
Part of Daily Dozen - 3 servings daily
Includes beans, chickpeas, split peas, and lentils
foods.benefits: Benefits excess body weight, insulin resistance, high cholesterol, inflammation, and oxidative stress. Makes them an important part of heart disease prevention and peripheral vascular disease prevention.

quotes: Legumes – beans, chickpeas, split peas, and lentils – are an excellent source of vitamins, minerals, fibre and antioxidants. In terms of nutrition density, they may give the biggest bang for the buck, benefitting excess body weight, insulin resistance, high cholesterol, inflammation, and oxidative stress, making them an important part of heart disease prevention. Meet my Daily Dozen requirement of a minimum of three daily servings, and your heart will thank you.

foods.name: Kale
properties: Part of Daily Dozen - 2 servings of greens daily
foods.benefits: Increased antioxidant capacity of blood, significant reductions of total cholesterol, LDL cholesterol, blood sugar levels, and oxidized LDL. Helps reduce risk of heart disease and strokes.
foods.amount: Daily consumption recommended (part of 2 servings of greens)

quotes: Study subjects ate kale and cabbage every day for two weeks and got increased antioxidant capacity of their blood and significant reductions of total cholesterol, LDL cholesterol, blood sugar levels, and oxidized LDL.

foods.name: Cabbage
properties: Helps prevent oxidation of LDL cholesterol
Part of Daily Dozen - 1 serving of cruciferous vegetables daily
foods.benefits: Helps reduce risk of heart disease and strokes through antioxidants preventing the oxidation of bad LDL cholesterol. Significant reductions in total cholesterol, LDL cholesterol, and blood sugar levels.
foods.amount: Daily consumption recommended (as part of cruciferous vegetables)

quotes: Increased fruit and vegetable consumption can help reduce risk of heart disease and strokes, partly due to their antioxidants preventing the oxidation of bad LDL cholesterol. Study subjects ate kale and cabbage every day for two weeks and got increased antioxidant capacity of their blood and significant reductions of total cholesterol, LDL cholesterol, blood sugar levels, and oxidized LDL.

foods.name: Vinegar
properties: Part of 21 Tweaks for weight loss
Can be sweet or savoury varieties
foods.benefits: Helps with weight loss and metabolism boosting. Incorporates into meals to enhance the ideal weight-loss diet. Provides metabolic benefits when consumed with meals.
foods.amount: 2 teaspoons with each meal (mixed in water or as dressing)

quotes: INCORPORATE VINEGAR (2 TEASPOONS WITH EACH MEAL) - Never drink vinegar straight. Instead, flavour meals or dress a side salad with any of the sweet or savoury vinegars out there. If you want to drink it, make sure to mix it in a glass of water, and afterwards, be sure to rinse your mouth out with water to protect your tooth enamel.

foods.name: Oat Groats (Whole Intact Oats)
properties: Part of Daily Dozen - 3 servings of whole grains daily
Better than steel-cut, rolled, or instant oats
foods.benefits: Provides fiber-encased calories which blunts glycemic impact, activates ileal brake that dials down appetite, and delivers sustenance to friendly gut flora. Better blood sugar control than processed oat forms.
foods.amount: Part of 3 daily servings of whole grains

quotes: Take oats, for example. They're found out in the fields as oat groats and then have their inedible outer husks removed during processing. Groats can then be sliced into two to four pieces to make steel-cut oats... Instead of buying boxed breakfast cereals, make oatmeal out of whole, intact oats. They're gr-r-oat!

foods.name: Flaxseeds (Ground)
properties: Part of Daily Dozen - 1 serving daily
Should be ground for optimal absorption
foods.benefits: Appetite suppression benefits. Provides essential omega-3 fatty acids and fiber. Supports digestive health and weight loss efforts.

quotes: In the Appetite Suppression section, we learned yet another reason to include ground flaxseeds in our daily diet.

foods.name: Berries
properties: Part of Daily Dozen - 1 serving daily
foods.benefits: High antioxidant content helps reduce inflammation and oxidative stress. Supports heart health and weight management. Low calorie density with high nutrient density.

foods.name: Greens (Low-Oxalate)
properties: Part of Daily Dozen - 2 servings daily
Should be eaten earlier in the meal
foods.benefits: Fat-blocking thylakoids and calcium support weight loss. Vegetables represent the healthiest class of foods with the fewest calories. Boost absorption of fat-soluble nutrients when paired with nuts.

quotes: Fat-blocking thylakoids and calcium are covered with my recommendation to eat lots of low-oxalate greens.
Since vegetables represent the healthiest class of foods with the fewest calories, we should aim to eat them earlier in the meal.

foods.name: Turmeric
properties: Part of Daily Dozen herbs and spices
Common in spice blends like Ras el Hanout
foods.benefits: Powerful anti-inflammatory properties. Supports weight loss and metabolic health. Contains curcumin which has numerous health benefits.
foods.amount: Daily use in cooking (part of herbs and spices serving)

quotes: Ras el Hanout spice blend contains: 1 teaspoon ground turmeric (among other anti-inflammatory spices)

foods.name: Nigella Seeds (Black Cumin)
properties: Part of 21 Tweaks for weight loss
Also known as black cumin or black seed
foods.benefits: Systematic review and meta-analysis of randomized, controlled weight-loss trials found that about 1/4 teaspoon of nigella seed powder every day appears to reduce body mass index within a span of a couple of months.

quotes: Nigella Seeds (Nigella sativa) (1/4 teaspoon) - As noted in the Appetite Suppression section of How Not to Diet, a systematic review and meta-analysis of randomized, controlled weight-loss trials found that about 1/4 teaspoon of nigella seed powder every day appears to reduce body mass index within a span of a couple of months.
